acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-001: Shipment Overview page accessible from the main navigation; - AC-002: Page title shows 'Shipment Overview'; - AC-003: Default view shows a table listing shipments with columns: Booking No, Customer Reference, POL, POD, ETD, ETA, Service, Status, Container Count
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-004: When the user clicks 'Shipment Overview' in the navigation, the page loads without full browser reload; - AC-005: When the page loads and the user has no active shipments, an empty state message is shown instead of a blank table
acceptance_logic: - AC-006: Only shipments belonging to the logged-in company are displayed; - AC-007: By default, only shipments with status in [Active, Loaded, In Transit] appear in the overview
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-008: Empty state message follows UX copy spec EMP-OV-001; - AC-009: If the shipment API returns an error, a generic error banner with support guidance is shown
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-001: Initial page render completes within 2 seconds for 95% of users; - NFR-002: API errors are logged with a correlation ID

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-010: The shipments table shows ETD and ETA columns with dates formatted as DD MMM YYYY; - AC-011: There is a visible indicator for 'Upcoming departures'
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-012: Default view is scoped to shipments with ETD within the next 7 days; - AC-013: Changing the date range refreshes the list; - AC-014: When more than 100 shipments match, pagination or lazy loading is available
acceptance_logic: - AC-015: Default filter logic: ETD between today and today+7 days inclusive; - AC-016: Shipments without an ETD are excluded from the upcoming view; - AC-017: Results are sorted by ETD ascending
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-018: For small viewports the table allows horizontal scroll without breaking column alignment
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-003: Changing filter or date range returns results within 1.5 seconds for 95% of requests

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-019: Filters are available for POL, POD, ETD range, ETA range and Status; - AC-020: Each filter control has a clear label and a sensible placeholder
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-021: Applying any filter updates the list to show matching shipments; - AC-022: Clearing all filters returns the list to the default upcoming view; - AC-023: Changing sort order updates the list accordingly
acceptance_logic: - AC-024: POL and POD filters match valid port codes/names; - AC-025: Status filter options align with allowed statuses [Active, Loaded, In Transit, Delayed]; - AC-026: If no shipments match the filters, a 'No results' message is shown
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-027: Filter controls follow existing platform patterns for labels and error states; - AC-028: Use of multi-select versus single-select filters follows UX spec FIL-OV-001
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-004: Applying filters returns results within 2 seconds for 95% of requests

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-029: Each row in the overview is clickable or has a clear 'View details' affordance; - AC-030: Shipment Detail view shows at minimum: Booking No, Customer Ref, POL, POD, ETD, ETA, Service, Status, Container Count
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-031: Clicking a shipment row opens the detail view in the same tab; - AC-032: Navigating back from detail preserves filters, sorting and scroll position
acceptance_logic: - AC-033: Shipment Detail data is fetched using the shipment's unique identifier; - AC-034: If the shipment is not found (API 404), the user sees a 'Shipment not found' message and a link back to the overview
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-035: Shipment Detail layout follows UX spec DET-OV-001; - AC-036: Opening a detail from a filtered list does not reset filters on return
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-005: Opening a Shipment Detail completes within 2 seconds for 95% of users
